notes: intransitive; mostly used in 3rd person; past participles: 'successo' (to happen) and 'succeduto' (to succeed/follow)
natural chiefly with 'succeed' sense in 1st person
example_sentence_italian: Io succedo a Marta come presidente.

notes: natural chiefly with 'succeed' sense in 2nd person
example_sentence_italian: Tu succedi a me nella turnazione.
example_sentence_english: You succeed me in the rotation.

example_sentence_italian: Voi succedete a loro in lista.
example_sentence_english: You succeed them on the list.

translation_english: I was happening/I used to succeed
example_sentence_italian: Succedevo sempre al mio capo nelle riunioni.
example_sentence_english: I always succeeded my boss in the meetings.

translation_english: you were happening/you used to succeed
he was happening/she was happening/you (formal) were happening
we were happening/we used to succeed
you (plural) were happening/you (plural) used to succeed
they were happening/they used to succeed

notes: used with auxiliary essere; rare with 1st person
used with auxiliary essere; rare with 1st person
used with auxiliary essere; rare with 2nd person
used with auxiliary essere; rare with 2nd person

translation_english: he has happened/she has happened/you (formal) have happened
notes: used with auxiliary essere; also used as formal 'Lei'

translation_english: he has happened/she has happened/you (formal) have happened
notes: used with auxiliary essere; also used as formal 'Lei'
